text: tucked discreetly away from the bustle of the main road in corstorphine lies a charming little cafe formerly known as cafe cibo and caffe citro its proximity to my workplace makes it the goto destination for lunches unfortunately with each subsequent renovation the cafe has experienced a slight decline in food quality despite this setback patrons can still rely on the tantalizing cakes however during my last visit i couldnt help but feel disappointed by the lackluster sandwich paired with cheap brown bread and mediocre salad all priced at £350 if only i had chosen the spinach tart instead on the bright side the original coffee bean continues to excel offering freshly brewed teas and homemade cakes moreover the little covered patio at the back provides an idyllic spot to relax during the warmer months

my hope is that they have made changes to the quality of the meat used in their burgers since my last visit which left me utterly disappointed by the exceptionally subpar experience of having one of the worst hamburgers ever the entire party i was dining with couldnt stand its rancid flavor and consequently returned their meals

in the midst of my dark and desolate travels i have encountered numerous commendable italians whom i now hold dear this leads me to feel personally affronted by the persistent stereotypes surrounding them firstly i must express my sincere gratitude to nunzio for his exceptional professionalism in running his waste management company secondly i genuinely appreciate the excellent service provided by pete the cheek at his auto body shop on long island lastly i extend my heartfelt thanks to giuseppe luigi franco peter paul anthony rossi a street sweeper who has become a cherished friend of mine our shared moments involve sipping amaretto chewing raw garlic and cooking pasta while engrossed in the godfather let me emphasize that these stereotypes are entirely baseless even though my efforts to convey this sentiment to my italian friends are often hindered by a mouth full of pizza and pasta

first the plusses  orchids garden offers dim sum all day not just during the morning and lunch hours  its inexpensive  two of us staggered out for 18 including tax and a generous tipnthe minuses  its way too far away from my apartment near unlv  as in too many transfers too long a bus ride  the dim sum was okay  we had a variety of dishes but nothing was superbnthe neithergoodnorbad  orchids garden also has americanstyle chinese food chow mein sweet and sour something  i saw an anglo couple im anglo too with those kinds of dishes on their table  there were also plenty of asians eating dim sum or real chinese food  if i were going out for chinese food with a very mixed group which would be my classmates or my former colleagues this would be a good choice because everyone could get something to their liking

looking for a good egg custard i ended up here after hearing about it being featured on the menu although the custard turned out to be enjoyable the disappointment came from the overly soft and mushy shell that couldnt maintain its structural integrity ultimately disintegrating additionally at the owners recommendation i tried their coconut buns and custard buns moving forward id suggest opting for the custard buns as the filling alone is worth revisiting for despite my longing to award this place with more stars i must acknowledge the kind nature of the proprietor who consistently goes above and beyond to help customers find what they want and provide suggestions she undoubtedly finds joy in her profession for those who are specifically craving egg custard this location stands as one of the scarce choices within pittsburgh

after hearing that hiphop was played on sundays at this venue my friends and i thought it would be a good spot to visit on our final night in vegas however upon approaching the entrance the male staff members refused to give me any of the free wristbands meant for girls this was surprising as i consider myself an attractive woman consequently we found ourselves in a disorganized line where the five bouncers seemed to have no criteria in selecting who to allow inside despite standing at the very front with my boyfriend for about 40 minutes the bouncer continually chose people behind or beside us intentionally excluding us from entry it didnt take long to realize that he had no intention of letting us in unless we provided him with a large tip like others were doing additionally i started suspecting that our denial might be because of our race which is unacceptable given the year was 2011 after enduring this treatment for approximately 45 minutes we made the decision to leave since it simply wasnt worth it to add insult to injury the establishment wasnt even playing hiphop music what a letdown

nestled away off the main road in corstorphine youll find this quaint cafe once known as cafe cibo and caffe citro being close to my workplace it has become the preferred choice for lunch outings regrettably over time the quality of food has somewhat diminished with each revamp of the cafe nevertheless the cakes still retain their delectable taste on my recent visit though i couldnt help but feel let down by the lackluster sandwich served on cheap brown bread accompanied by uninspiring salad all for the price of £350 in hindsight i should have opted for the spinach tart nonetheless the original coffee bean continues to impress with its fresh teas and homemade cakes the icing on the cake is the lovely covered patio in the back which provides a delightful setting during warmer months

solid burritos especially the carnitas burrito didnt try the tacos but they have a large menu will definitely be back a good alternative when i dont want to drive 15 miles to my favorite burrito shop very reasonable prices less than 5 for a good sized burrito my main concern is that i have always been the only customer come on and give it a try i dont want to see them go under

making a pit stop at layers presents an excellent opportunity to relish delectable bakery treats and mouthwatering meals however one must consider that it comes with a hefty price tag necessitating a substantial financial commitment when dining with my partner and loved ones appreciating the freshness of the ingredients used and the helpfulness of the staff it holds a special position as a beloved local gathering spot

besides nobu this place is our preferred sushi spot it offers an impressive range of dishes at an incredibly reasonable price the quality of the food is outstanding and everything is prepared fresh and to perfection considering the amount of sushi we typically eat around 150 worth the allyoucaneat option is remarkably priced in my opinion its the best sushi restaurant in las vegas that gives you great value for your money

from june 29 2012 to july 1 2012 i spent my time at this establishment due to obtaining a good deal we chose the standard luxury room for our stay arriving very late approximately 100 am on saturday morning we were granted a complimentary upgrade to a le mans suite because they had exhausted their supply of standard luxury rooms it turned out to be delightful the le mans suite boasted exquisite decor and highquality furnishings the bathroom not only housed a spacious shower and a hot tub but also featured a bidet the only odd thing about the whole experience was the presence of an oldschool box tv despite that the room was otherwise remarkable

a friend of mine took my to tommy vs for my dirty thirty birthday the waitress upon finding out it was my birthday gave us a free appetizer limocello shot desert and after dinner cappuccino it was very nice of her to do all that for me it was way beyond  the standard free desert you get anywhere else the appetizer she gave us was the burrata and it was simply amazing the mozzarella literally melts in your mouth we had also ordered the pancetta wrapped prawns and they were delicious as well for dinner i had the salmon and it was absolutely perfect crisp on the outside tender on the inside and full of flavor it really hit the spot i had thought about ordering the sea bass but the waitress advised against it letting me know that it isnt one of their best dishes i always appreciate it when the server will steer you in the right direction so you enjoy your meal i couldnt have enjoyed the dinner more and will definitely be coming back to tommy vs thank you to my friend and the waitress for a great dinner and dirty thirty

my intention was to swiftly have a manicure done yet upon arrival i was convinced by their assurance that choosing gel nails for 30 would be more longlasting the predicament arose when the resulting nails appeared overly thick and unnatural bearing a resemblance to poorly executed acrylics in addition they started peeling off after only a couple of days causing me to decide against revisiting this place

the hubs and i had to try this place passed it several times had the oysters calamari halibut and ahi everything was pretty good the only thing i wasnt a fan of were the cats in the dining room im not a cat person and having them near food is unsanitary

my friend treated me to a meal at tommy vs for my 30th birthday the waitress after learning it was my special day surprised us with a complimentary appetizer limocello shot dessert and cappuccino after dinner her generosity went above and beyond the standard free dessert offered elsewhere the burrata appetizer she brought was incredibly delicious with the mozzarella literally melting in your mouth we also ordered the tasty pancettawrapped prawns for my main course i opted for the perfect salmon crispy on the outside tender inside and bursting with flavor although i initially considered ordering the sea bass the waitress advised against it ensuring that i made the right choice i truly appreciated her guidance and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our dinner at tommy vs im definitely looking forward to returning to this wonderful restaurant a big thank you goes out to my friend and the amazing waitress for making my dirty thirty celebration so memorable

this sushi restaurant besides nobu is not only my husbands and my favorite but also amazingly affordable with a wide variety of dishes the freshness and deliciousness are well worth the cost normally we spend around 150 on sushi so the allyoucaneat option is surprisingly reasonably priced considering how much we consume i believe it is the top choice for reasonably priced sushi in las vegas

the quality of this place has significantly declined since its prime time i havent visited in more than a year because during 20122013 every time i went hoping for the same excellence it once had it turned out to be mediocre at best despite that my preferred sushi spot still offers great food i highly recommend trying the sanchez roll chimi chonga and surfer—they are amazing the ambiance is also pleasing although im not particularly fond of sushi this place truly ignites my appetite for it

arriving on sunday december 16th 2012 we booked a new grand king room for a twonight stay at a rate of 6320 per night after taxes which included the resort fee initially our expectations were modest compared to the more modern hotels in las vegas however upon seeing the wonderfully renovated and modern rooms we were pleasantly surprised we found them to be superior to other hotels in its class such as the mirage and treasure island we would say the same about the hard rock but our experience there has always been an upgrade to the luxurious king suite in the hrh allsuite tower  making it an unfair comparison checking in at 2 am meant no waiting in line and the checkout process was made easy with a convenient stack of cards next to the elevator just remember that like many older casino resorts in las vegas there might be some walking involved from the selfpark lot to your room

this place caught our attention multiple times while passing by so the hubs and i felt compelled to give it a try we sampled different items from the menu such as oysters calamari halibut and ahi and found them to be fairly tasty overall however one thing that bothered me was the presence of cats inside the dining room since i have an aversion to them and having them nearby while people are eating seems unclean

the brightly painted shack offers a variety of flavored syrups over shaved ice which is exactly as it sounds  simply shaved ice that provides a delightful texture and consistency choose from an array of flavors such as bubblegum sour apple cola mai thai and even toothpaste dont miss out on the opportunity to try their deliciously sour sour grenade or the refreshing mai thai just like the cocktail mediumsized servings are incredibly affordable at only 2 its a hidden gem that many people may not be aware of so why not take a drive and enjoy a snowball on a summer evening after a rainstorm or anytime youre ready for a unique taste experience

layers is a good place to stop off and enjoy bakery items and food  its pricey and to take my hubby and family costs an arm and a leg  ingredients are fresh  staff is helpful  its definitely a local hangout

i am pleasantly surprised by the restaurants lower rating despite frequenting this place with my husband and always enjoying our meals i expected a higher rating i highly recommend their burgers pot roast balls and chicken and waffles the fries are delicious although im unsure if they are made inhouse or not their irish nachos and cheese curds on the other hand were not exceptional however when they served poutine once it was incredible in my opinion this is one of the best affordable restaurants in madison i appreciate that they offer a variety of burgers sandwiches and entrees additionally the food has consistently been served promptly which is especially satisfying when arriving famished

seeking to satiate my desire for a mouthwatering dessert consisting of rich egg custard my journey led me here under the impression that it was readily available on their wellcrafted menu although the custard itself turned out to possess the desired flavor and quality i encountered disappointment when it came to the soft and flimsy shell encasing it which could not withstand even the gentlest touch without crumbling apart nonetheless i decided to explore further based on the proprietors encouragement and sampled her coconut pastries in addition to the custardfilled buns in future visits i wholeheartedly recommend opting for the custard buns as they justify a return trip solely due to their delightful filling it is regrettable that i am unable to provide this establishment with a higher rating as the affable proprietor consistently displays a genuine passion for assisting customers find what they desire or offering valuable recommendations if you ever feel an uncontrollable craving for egg custard remember that pittsburgh offers few options making this place one worth considering

the word on the street was that they played hiphop music every sunday so we thought it would be a great idea to check out this venue on our final night in las vegas however as we walked up to the entrance the bouncers neglected to give me and my friends any of the coveted girls get in free wristbands this immediately puzzled me because ive always considered myself an attractive woman i couldnt fathom their reasoning behind excluding us consequently what followed was a chaotic queue with five bouncers who seemed to choose people randomly without any apparent order despite waiting at the very front of the line for approximately 40 minutes the bouncer consistently overlooked my boyfriend and me while selecting others around us it soon became evident that he had no intention of letting us in unless we tipped him generously like some of the other patrons did in addition i cant help but think that our race played a role in his decision seriously its 2011 its high time you shed your biases after putting up with this treatment for about 45 minutes we ultimately decided to leave the entire experience just wasnt worth the frustration particularly since they werent even playing hiphop music talk about a massive disappointment

it is quite surprising to me that this restaurants rating is not higher considering my husband and i dine here frequently and have never had a negative experience i highly recommend their burgers pot roast balls and chicken and waffles although im unsure if their fries are housemade they are undeniably delicious among the appetizers weve tried both the irish nachos and cheese curds were underwhelming except for one memorable occasion when they offered poutine which was fantastic in my opinion this is one of the top affordable restaurants in madison i appreciate that they offer a variety of options from burgers to sandwiches and proper entrees additionally the prompt service ensures that hungry guests receive their food promptly

culinary dropout boasts commendable culinary offerings which would warrant a respectable rating if solely focused on food nevertheless the inconvenience of parking hampers its desirability instead of dealing with the hassle of valet services it is preferable to park conveniently nearby and directly access the restaurant regrettably our dining experience was marred by an awful ambiance created by excessive noise live music combined with the patrons incessant shouting made holding a conversation nearly impossible in a typical restaurant setting people expect to engage in meaningful conversations yet this particular establishment fails to deliver in that aspect to our surprise the management justified their intentional disregard for conversation despite an enticing menu filled with an interesting variety of soups salads sandwiches main entrees and an extensive craft beer selection we hesitate to consider dining there due to the overwhelming noise level consulting with friends we discovered they shared the same sentiment if you enjoy the lively atmosphere of a noisy restaurant and arent bothered by valet parking then this might be the place for you but it certainly doesnt meet our preferences

for ten years in a row a group of old pals from high school and i have made it a tradition to come to this joint once annually typically we walk away more than satisfied just indulging in a scrumptious meal together unfortunately our most recent visit left us all feeling extremely disappointed the steaks were inexplicably dry as if they had been neglected under a heat lamp for an extended period and dont even get me started on the presentation it was downright dreadful instead of seeing a beautifully plated dish we were faced with an unappetizing sight a hunk of overcharred meat juxtaposed against a stark white background i personally opted for the cajun ribeye which turned out to be a terrible choice the rub lacked moisture the steak itself was terribly dried out and to add insult to injury it was excessively charred similarly our companions filets were met with dissatisfying outcomes rumor has it that the restaurant recently went through a change in ownership possibly explaining the rapid downfall of what was once a highly regarded steakhouse

i really wish there was an alternative for zero stars when reviewing this place upon presenting my restaurantcom gift certificate they had the audacity to declare it as fraudulent and reject it contrary to their claims i am well aware that restaurantcom is a legitimate company as i have used their services without any issues numerous times before i even exhibited pictorial evidence of their featured restaurant on their website to our waitress but received no response with a baby on the way finances are tight which led us to dine there solely because of the certificate my hungry husband ordered nevertheless due to their dubious nature i adamantly refused to consume or drink anything served at this establishment
